Since I first came to Congress I have continually fought for necessary funding to update infrastructure like the Portal Bridge. I am glad to see these funds disbursed that will help secure the Portal Bridge while keeping our infrastructure and economy moving.
This funding will allow for appropriate changes that will ensure the full operation of the Portal Bridge.

This century-old bridge has desperately needed funding for years. Although a crucial piece of infrastructure for the Northeast, the bridge sometimes has to be locked into place by workers with sledgehammers.

The Portal Bridge is essential in connecting the entire northeast corridor from Boston to Washington D.C. The bridge carries an average of 450 trains and 200,000 passengers each day, and is essential for moving the economy of NJ and the entire Northeast.

The Federal Railroad Administration just announced $91.5 million in funding to help advance the replacement of the Portal North Bridge and to make upgrades along the Amtrak Northeast Corridor (NEC). https://sires.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/sires-menendez-booker-pascrell-payne-malinowski-announce-915m-to-advance

7/ He wanted me at that speech, but he also wanted the Senators who stubbornly oppose changing any gun laws to be there. 

He wanted each side to hear the case for what the Senate COULD be - a place where common ground is found, not just a place where battle lines are hardened.

6/ Doug is to the right of me on guns. He doesn‚Äôt support all the things I support. But he also can‚Äôt fathom doing nothing. And the gun owners he hunts with agree. 

For 20 amazing minutes, he made the case that the issue of guns can actually UNITE Americans.

5/ I nervously took my seat the next day for his speech.

What followed was one of the most miraculous speeches I have ever heard in person. 

Doug Jones, Senator from Alabama, speaking truth about guns in America.

4/ I panicked. I went back to my office and told my staff that Doug Jones was giving his first speech on guns. 

I assumed that he was going to draw a line in the sand and position himself as the immovable right flank of the debate in the Democratic caucus.

3/ On March 20, 2018, he flagged me down - the first time he had sought me out that year. 

He said ‚ÄúChris, I‚Äôd like you to be on the floor for my maiden speech tomorrow. It‚Äôs going to be on a topic you care about - gun violence‚Äù.

2/ I hadn‚Äôt spent a ton of time w Doug during his first 2 months in the Senate. He seemed thoughtful and earnest, and my assumption was that he‚Äôd avoid anything controversial. That‚Äôs what any political consultant would have told him to do.

1/ I want to tell you a quick story of my first substantive conversation with Doug Jones. 

And how no other Senator has done more to show me what the Senate COULD be.

If you read it to the end, I know you‚Äôll make a contribution to his campaign tonight.

Similar to the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act that I championed to help rebuild NYC after 9/11, the federal government would serve as a backstop in the Pandemic Risk Insurance Act to ensure these policies are widely available, affordable, and maintain marketplace stability.

My bill would also create a Pandemic Risk Reinsurance Program that will share this burden between insurance companies and the federal government to ensure there is enough funding to cover losses caused by any future pandemics.
The Pandemic Risk Insurance Act would require insurance companies to offer business interruption insurance policies ‚Äî including event cancellation ‚Äî that include pandemics.

That means millions of small businesses, nonprofits, mom and pop shops, and retailers are being denied claims from their insurance companies. 

They have been left out in cold & these denials increase the likelihood they will never be financially recover from #COVID19.

While business interruption insurance typically compensates business owners when they need to shut down due to exigent circumstances ‚Äì like a tornado ripping through Main Street ‚Äì those policies explicitly exclude pandemics.

Today, I joined @NonprofitNY, @UStravel, and @NRFnews to introduce the Pandemic Risk Insurance Act.

This bill will help businesses suffering from #COVID19 & protect our economy from future pandemics by providing a federal backstop for insurance that includes pandemic coverage. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EY-TvZqXsAAofvG.jpg
